QuestionText: A client sends an HTTP request to a load balancer, which routes it to one of the multiple web servers. What is the primary benefit of using a load balancer in this scenario?
OptionA: Improved security by hiding IP addresses of web servers behind the load balancer
OptionB: Reduced latency by caching frequently accessed resources
OptionC: Increased scalability and availability by distributing incoming traffic across multiple web servers
OptionD: Enhanced performance by compressing data packets before forwarding them to web servers

QuestionText: In a distributed database system, what is the main reason for using a consensus protocol like Raft or Paxos?
OptionA: To ensure that all nodes in the system have the same clock time
OptionB: To prevent split-brain scenarios by achieving agreement on a single value
OptionC: To reduce latency by caching frequently accessed data
OptionD: To increase security by encrypting data in transit

QuestionText: A system consists of a single point of failure, which can bring down the entire system if it fails. What is the name of the design principle that aims to mitigate this risk?
In a microservices architecture, what is the purpose of a service registry like etcd or ZooKeeper?
OptionA: To provide a centralized repository for storing and retrieving microservice instances
OptionB: To handle service communication between microservices
OptionC: To manage the life cycle of microservices
OptionD: To monitor the performance of microservices

QuestionText: A system requires a high-performance, low-latency storage solution for storing metadata. Which of the following storage solutions is most suitable for this requirement?
In a content delivery network (CDN), what is the primary purpose of a edge server?
OptionA: To cache frequently accessed static content at a location closer to the end-user
OptionB: To handle dynamic content by executing server-side logic
OptionC: To provide load balancing and distribute traffic across multiple origin servers
OptionD: To optimize network routing and reduce latency

QuestionText: A system uses a workflow engine like Apache Airflow to manage the life cycle of batch jobs. What is the primary benefit of using a workflow engine?
OptionA: Improved performance by executing tasks in parallel
OptionB: Increased reliability by automatically retrying failed tasks
OptionC: Enhanced observability by providing a centralized view of workflow execution

QuestionText: In a distributed system, what is the name of the problem that occurs when two nodes make conflicting changes to the system state?

A system uses a caching layer to improve performance by reducing the number of requests to the underlying database. Which of the following cache invalidation strategies is most suitable for a read-heavy workload?
OptionA: Cache invalidation based on a TTL (time-to-live) timer
OptionB: Cache invalidation based on a TTL timer with a low TTL value
OptionC: Cache invalidation based on a percentage of cache hits

QuestionText: In a system with a high volume of incoming requests, what is the primary benefit of using a message queue like Apache Kafka?
OptionA: Improved performance by executing requests in parallel
OptionB: Increased reliability by automatically retrying failed requests
OptionC: Decoupling of producers and consumers to handle large volumes of requests
OptionD: Reduced latency by caching frequently accessed resources
